snippet: The Kurdish region resumed pumping crude oil earmarked for export through the central government’s pipeline after halting it for four months over what Kurdish authorities called a payment dispute.
abstract: Iraq’s self-ruled northern Kurdish region has resumed pumping crude oil earmarked for export through the central government’s pipeline after halting it for four months over what Kurdish authorities called a payment dispute; car bomb kills 11 people when it explodes near a gathering of Shiite Muslims south of Baghdad.
lead_paragraph: The Kurdish region resumed pumping crude oil earmarked for export through the central government’s pipeline after halting it for four months over what Kurdish authorities called a payment dispute.

headline.main: Iraq: After Standoff, Kurds Resume Pumping Oil for Iraq Exports
headline.print_headline: Iraq: After Standoff, Kurds Resume Pumping Oil for Iraq Exports
